upon conviction be fined not less than five hundred dollars ($500.00) for each offense.
B. Each day that a violation is permitted to exist after notification thereof shall constitute a separate offense. (Ord. 2011-70, 10-18-2011)

Chapter 2
RULES AND DEFINITIONS
10-2-1: RULES OF WORD CONSTRUCTION:
In the construction of this title and any subsequent amendment, the rules and definitions contained in this chapter shall be observed and applied, except
when the context clearly indicates otherwise:
A. Words used in the present tense shall include the future.
B. Words used in the singular number shall include the plural number.
C. The words "shall" and "must" are mandatory.
D. The words "may" and "should" are permissive.
E. The word "lot" shall include the words "place" and "parcel".
F. The word "structure" shall include the word "building".
G. The phrase "used for" shall include the phrases "arranged for", "designed for", "intended for", "maintained for", and "occupied for".
H. The word "person" shall include a "firm, association, organization, partnership, trust, company or corporation or any other entity as well as an
individual".
I. The masculine gender includes the feminine and neutral. (Ord. 2011-70, 10-18-2011)
10-2-2: DEFINITIONS:
The following words and terms shall have the meaning set forth, except where otherwise specifically indicated. Words and terms not defined shall have the
meaning indicated by common dictionary definition.
ACRE: A measure of land containing forty three thousand five hundred sixty (43,560) square feet.
ADJACENT: To touch, to abut, to lie immediately next to, and/or to share a common wall or lot line.
ADULT USES: Adult bookstores, adult cabarets, adult entertainment establishments, adult mini-motion picture theaters, adult motion picture theaters and
adult novelty stores, or any combination thereof, as follows:
Adult Bookstore: An establishment having a substantial or significant portion of its stock in trade, books, magazines, "adult motion pictures" (as
defined herein) and/or other periodicals that are distinguished or characterized by their emphasis on matters depicting, describing or relating to
"specified sexual activities" or "specified anatomical areas" (as defined herein), or an establishment with a segment or section devoted to the sale or
display of such material.
Adult Cabaret: An establishment offering to its patrons as entertainment, any live exhibition or display or any theatrical or live performances that
feature topless dancers, go-go dancers, exotic dancers, strippers, male or female impersonators, or similar entertainers, or any persons singing,
reading, posing, modeling or serving food or beverages where such exhibition, performance, display or dance is intended to sexually arouse the
entertainer or the patrons, or where the attire of the persons involved is such to expose "specified anatomical areas" (as defined herein).
Adult Entertainment Establishment: Any adult bookstore, adult motion picture theater, adult mini-picture theater, cabaret or other commercial
establishment open to the public which: a) displays, distributes, issues, gives, provides, lends, delivers, transfers, transmits, circulates, disseminates,
presents, exhibits, advertises, sells, rents or leases a substantial or significant portion of its stock in trade, any material depicting, describing or
relating to specified sexual activities and/or specified anatomical areas; b) utilizes a substantial or significant part of its display areas, including, but
not limited to, floor, shelf, rack, table, stand, case, display areas, boxes, cabinets, drawers, cartons or any other storage area or apparatus, for any
material characterized by the depiction of specified sexual activities or specified anatomical areas; or c) exhibits for a substantial or significant portion
of the total representation time, any material characterized by the depiction of specified sexual activities or specified anatomical areas. An "adult
entertainment establishment" shall be further defined as any commercial establishment open to the public which involves employees or customers
who engage in conduct which is distinguished or characterized by specified sexual activities and/or specified anatomical areas.
Adult Mini-Motion Picture Theater: An enclosed building with a capacity for less than fifty (50) persons used for presenting "adult motion pictures" (as
defined herein) material distinguished or characterized by an emphasis on matters depicting, describing or relating to specified sexual activities or
specified anatomical areas, for observation by patrons therein.
Adult Motion Picture Theater: An enclosed building with a capacity of fifty (50) or more persons used for presenting "adult motion pictures" (as
defined herein) and/or material distinguished or characterized by an emphasis on matters depicting, describing or relating to specified sexual
activities or specified anatomical areas, for observation by patrons therein.
6/5/2019 Sterling Codifiers, Inc.
https://www.sterlingcodifiers.com/codebook/index.php?book_id=715 366/702
Adult Motion Pictures: Films, motion pictures, video cassettes or tapes, slides or similar photographic reproductions which are characterized by the
depiction of specified sexual activities and/or specified anatomical areas.
Adult Novelty Store: An establishment having at least twenty five percent (25%) of its sales or stock in trade consisting of toys, devices, clothing,
novelties, lotions and other items distinguished or characterized by their emphasis on or use for specialized sexual activities or specified anatomical
areas, or an establishment that holds itself out to the public as a purveyor of such materials based upon its signage, advertising, displays, actual
sales, exclusion of minors from the establishment's premises or any other factors showing the establishment's primary purpose is to purvey such
material.
Specified Anatomical Areas: Less than completely and opaquely covered:
A. Human genitals, pubic region, and
B. Buttock, and
C. Female breast below a point immediately above the top of the areola, and
D. Human male genitals in a discernibly turgid state, even if completely and opaquely covered.
Specified Sexual Activities: Means and includes any of the following:
A. Human genitals in a state of sexual stimulation or arousal.
B. Acts of human masturbation, sexual intercourse, sodomy, bestiality, oral copulation or flagellation.
C. Fondling or other erotic touching of human genitals, pubic region, buttock or female breast.
D. Excretory functions as part of or in connection with any of the activities set forth in subsections A through C of this definition.
AGRICULTURAL BUILDING OR STRUCTURE: A building or structure existing or erected on land used principally for agricultural purposes, with the
exception of dwelling units.
AGRICULTURE: The use of at least two (2) acres of land for crop production or raising of livestock and farm animals. The term "agricultural" encompasses
the farmhouse, and accessory uses and structures customarily incidental to agricultural activities.
AIRPORT: Any premises which is used or intended for use for the landing or takeoff of aircraft, including any associated areas which are used or intended
for use by buildings and structures incidental to aircraft uses.
ALL-TERRAIN VEHICLE: Any motorized device designed to travel primarily off public streets, fifty inches (50") or less in width, having a manufacturer's
dry weight of one thousand five hundred (1,500) pounds or less, traveling on three (3) or more tires, designed with a seat or saddle for operator use, and
handlebars or steering wheel for steering control, except lawnmowers.
ALLEY: Any public right-of-way which normally affords a secondary means of access to adjoining property. Frontage on an alley shall not be construed as
satisfying the requirements related to frontage on a dedicated street. A street shall not be considered an alley.
AMENDMENT: A revision or addition to all or a portion of this title which has been adopted by the Board of Trustees of the Village of Bartlett.
AMORTIZATION: A method of eliminating nonconforming uses or structures by requiring the termination of the nonconforming use or structure after a
specified period of time.
AMUSEMENT DEVICE: Any machine or electronic device which may be operated by the public generally for use as a game, entertainment or amusement,
whether or not registering a score. It shall include such devices as marble machines, pinball machines, electronic and other mechanical amusement
machines, skill ball, mechanical grab machines, video games, virtual reality games and other similar games, operations or devices however designated;
but shall not include any music vending machines, contrivance or device commonly known as a "jukebox" which produces, plays or emits songs, music or
other prerecorded entertainment; bowling alleys; pool and billiard games; sports training devices, provided they are not operated by the insertion of a coin,
slug, token, plate, disk or debit card, and using full size regulation equipment; miniature golf, games played on a computer on the internet provided the
computer is not operated by the insertion of a coin, slug, token or disk; and games at carnivals approved in accordance with this title as a temporary use.
ANIMAL, DOMESTIC: An animal, bird or reptile that is tame or domesticated and is not normally found on a farm or in the wild. Hybrids or animals
normally found on a farm or in the wild are not included within the definition of a domestic animal.
ANIMAL GROOMING, SALES AND SERVICE: Any place or establishment, public or private, where animals are bathed, clipped, or combed for the
purpose of enhancing their aesthetic value or health and for which a fee is charged.
ANIMAL HOSPITAL AND VETERINARY OFFICE: A structure where animals or pets are given medical or surgical treatment on an outpatient and/or
overnight basis.
ANIMAL SHELTER: A facility used to house or contain stray, homeless, abandoned, or unwanted animals and that is owned, operated, or maintained by a
public body, an established humane society, animal welfare society, society for the prevention of cruelty to animals, or other nonprofit organization devoted
to the welfare, protection, and humane treatment of animals.
ANNEXATION: The incorporation of a contiguous land area into an existing municipality with a resulting change in the corporate boundaries of that
municipality.
APARTMENT: Self-contained housing unit arranged, intended or designed as living quarters for an individual, group of individuals, or a family, that
occupies only part of a building. Apartments may be owned (by an owner-occupier) or rented (by tenants).
ARCADE: Public gaming facility offering five (5) or more amusement devices.
6/5/2019 Sterling Codifiers, Inc.
https://www.sterlingcodifiers.com/codebook/index.php?book_id=715 367/702
ART GALLERY: An establishment engaged in the sale, loan or display of art, paintings, sculpture, or other works of art. Does not include a place designed
to be used as a dwelling unit.
ART STUDIO: Place designed to be used as, both a dwelling place and a place of work by the artisan, or craftsperson, including persons engaged in the
application, teaching, or performance of fine art.
AWNING: Any structure entirely supported by the wall to which it is attached and which has a frame covered by a temporary material and/or which can be
retracted against the wall by which it is supported.
BALCONY: An elevated platform projecting from and supported by a structure without additional independent supports.
BANK, CREDIT UNION, OR SAVINGS AND LOAN: A financial institution that is open to the public and engaged in deposit banking, and that performs
closely related functions such as making loans, investments, and fiduciary activities.
BASEMENT: That portion of a building having more than one-half (1/2) of its height below lot grade.
BAY WINDOW: A window projecting beyond the wall line of the building and not supported by a foundation.
BED AND BREAKFAST ESTABLISHMENTS: An owner occupied structure providing overnight accommodations for a charge to the public. Breakfasts may
be provided to the guests only. Bed and breakfasts shall not include motels, hotels, boarding houses, or food service establishments.
BERM: A mound of soil, either natural or manmade, used to screen and visually separate, in part or entirely, one (1) area, site or property from the view of
another area.
BIOSWALE: A shallow, low gradient swale vegetated with turf grass or native plants. Water runs through the swale as a slow shallow sheet flow, allowing
infiltration and evaporation. These can be designed with adequate storage volume and cross sectional areas to hold and convey runoff from a desired
design storm event.
FIGURE 2-1
BIOSWALE CROSS SECTION
6/5/2019 Sterling Codifiers, Inc.

BLOCK: A tract of land bounded by streets, or by a combination of streets and public parks, cemeteries, railroad rights of way, bulkhead lines or shorelines
of waterways, or boundary lines of the village.
BLOCK FACE: The properties on one side of a street, between two (2) intersecting streets or, in the case of a dead end street, between an intersecting
street and the end of the street.
BOARD OF TRUSTEES: The president and board of trustees of the village of Bartlett, Illinois.
BUFFERING: Any means of protecting adjacent properties from the visual or auditory effects of a different or more intense use. "Buffering" may include,
but is not limited to, berming, fencing, landscaping, providing greater setbacks or providing open spaces.
BUILDABLE AREA: The area of the lot remaining after the minimum open space, setback and yard requirements of this title have been complied with.
BUILDING: Any structure used or intended for supporting or sheltering any use or occupancy.
Building, Accessory: A detached subordinate building or a portion of a principal building, the use of which is incidental to that of the primary use of
the principal building. (See figure 2-2 of this section.)
Building, Conforming: Any building or structure which:
A. Complies with all the regulations of this title and of any amendment hereto;
B. Complies with all the bulk regulations of the district in which it is located; and
C. Is designed or intended for a use permitted in the district in which it is located.
6/5/2019 Sterling Codifiers, Inc.
https://www.sterlingcodifiers.com/codebook/index.php?book_id=715 369/702
Building, Detached: A building which does not have a wall or roof in common with another structure. (See figure 2-2 of this section.)
Building, Nonconforming: Any building or structure or portion thereof lawfully existing at the time of adoption of this title, or amendment thereto, which
does not comply with all of the bulk regulations of this title for the district in which it is located.
Building, Principal: A permanent building in which the principal use of the lot on which it is located is conducted. (See figure 2-2 of this section.)
FIGURE 2-2
BUILDINGS
BUILDING CODE: The building code of the village of Bartlett.
BUILDING HEIGHT: The vertical distance measured from the finished grade to the average overall height of the roof surface.
FIGURE 2-3
EXAMPLE OF BUILDING HEIGHTS
6/5/2019 Sterling Codifiers, Inc.
https://www.sterlingcodifiers.com/codebook/index.php?book_id=715 370/702
BUILDING MATERIAL SALES: Establishments or places of business primarily engaged in retail or wholesale, from the premises, of materials used in the
construction of buildings or other structures. Typical uses include building material stores and home supply establishments.
BULK (REGULATIONS): Standards that control the size and setbacks of buildings or structures and the location of same with respect to one another, and
includes, but not limited to, the following:
A. Size and height of buildings.
B. Location of exterior walls at all levels in relation to lot lines, streets or to other buildings (yards and setbacks).
C. Gross floor area of buildings in relation to lot area (floor area ratio).
D. All open spaces allocated to buildings.
E. Amount of lot area provided per dwelling unit.
F. Lot width and area.
BUSINESS PARK: A planned, coordinated development of a tract of land designed and equipped to accommodate a combination of commercial, office
and light industrial uses, providing them with all necessary facilities and services with special attention to circulation, parking, aesthetics and compatibility
among neighbors.
CANNABIS CULTIVATION CENTER: A facility operated by an organization or business that is registered by the Illinois Department of Agriculture to
perform necessary activities to provide only registered medical cannabis grown and cultivated to be packaged and distributed to registered medical
cannabis dispensing organizations with usable medical cannabis in accordance with the laws of the State of Illinois. In addition a cultivation center must be
located at least two thousand five hundred feet (2,500') from any daycare center, school or area zoned for residential use.
CANOPY: Any permanent exterior roof structure attached to a building at the inner end and supported on the outer end in conformance with the Building
Code of the Village of Bartlett.
CAR WASH: A building or portion thereof containing facilities for washing one (1) or more motor vehicles, using automatic production line methods with a
chain conveyor, blower, steam cleaning device or other mechanical devices; or providing space, water and equipment for the hand washing of autos,
whether by the customer or the operator.
CEMETERY: Land used or intended to be used for the burial of human remains and dedicated for cemetery purposes, including crematories, mausoleums,
crematorium, columbaria, chapels and mortuaries if operated in connection with and within the boundaries of such cemetery.
CEMETERY, PET: Land used or intended to be used for the burial of domestic animal remains and dedicated for cemetery purposes, including
crematories, mausoleums, crematorium, columbaria, chapels and mortuaries if operated in connection with and within the boundaries of such cemetery.
CHIMNEY: A primarily vertical enclosure containing one (1) or more passageways for conveying flue gases to the outside atmosphere.
CLINIC, MEDICAL OR DENTAL: A facility operated by one (1) or more physicians, dentists, or other licensed practitioner for the examination and
treatment of persons on an outpatient basis only.
CLUB, PRIVATE (NONPROFIT): A nonprofit association of persons, who are bona fide members paying annual dues, which owns, hires or leases a
building, or portion thereof; the use of such premises being restricted to members and their guests. Food and alcoholic beverages may be served on its
premises, provided that they are secondary and incidental to the principal use, provided that sale of the alcoholic beverages is in compliance with the
applicable Federal, State, County and Village laws.
CLUSTER DEVELOPMENT: A development design technique that concentrates buildings in specific areas on a site to allow the remaining land to be used
for recreation, common open space and preservation of environmentally sensitive features.
COLONY: A hive and its equipment and appurtenances, including bees, comb, honey, pollen and brood.
COMMODITY: A tangible item that may be bought or sold; something produced for commerce. Intangibles, such as human labor, services, or advertising,
are generally not considered to be commodities.
COMMON OPEN SPACE: Land or water unoccupied by structures, buildings, streets, rights-of-way and automobile parking lots and designed and
intended for the use or enjoyment in common of residents of a residential development. Common open space may contain walks, patios and structures for
recreational use. Area used for individual open space, such as private courtyards, and not available to all residents of the residential development shall not
be included as common open space.
COMMUNICATION ANTENNA: Any exterior apparatus designed for telephone, personal wireless services, broadband, radio or television communications
through the sending and/or receiving of electromagnetic waves.
COMMUNICATION TOWER: A structure designed and constructed primarily for the purpose of supporting one (1) or more communications antennas,
including self-supporting lattice towers, guy towers and monopole towers. This use includes radio and television transmission towers, personal
communication services (PCS), microwave towers, common carriers towers, and the like. This use does not include any structure erected solely for a
residential, noncommercial individual use, such as television reception antennas, satellite dishes or noncommercial wireless antennas (amateur radio).
COMMUNITY CENTER: A facility providing social, cultural and/or recreational programs generally open to the public and designed to accommodate and
serve significant segments of the community.
COMMUNITY RESIDENCE: A group home or specialized residential care home which is owned and/or operated by a public or private institution, and is
used for or intended to be used for rehabilitative programs that serve either persons with disabilities, persons as an alternative to incarceration for a
criminal offense or persons whose primary reason for placement is treatment of a communicable disease. Community residences shall be licensed,
6/5/2019 Sterling Codifiers, Inc.
https://www.sterlingcodifiers.com/codebook/index.php?book_id=715 371/702
certified and/or accredited by the appropriate state and/or local agency.
COMPREHENSIVE PLAN: The official comprehensive plan of the village of Bartlett adopted by the village board in May 1978 and as amended from time
to time.
CONFORMING BUILDING: See definition of Building: Building, Conforming.
CONVENIENCE STORE: Any retail establishment offering for sale a limited line of groceries and household items intended for the convenience of the
neighborhood.
DAYCARE CENTER, ADULT: A facility providing care for the elderly and/or functionally impaired adults in a protective setting for less than twenty four (24)
hours per day.
DAYCARE CENTER, CHILD: A facility, other than a residential building, providing care for children for less than twenty four (24) hours per day, which
meets the licensing requirements of the state of Illinois, department of children and family services. Child daycare center does not include programs
operated by public or private elementary and secondary schools, or institutions of higher learning which serve children who are three (3) years of age or
older.
DAYCARE, GROUP HOME: A family home which receives four (4) up to a maximum of sixteen (16) children for less than twenty four (24) hours per day,
which meets the licensing requirements of the state of Illinois, department of children and family services. The number counted includes the family's
natural or adopted children and all other persons under the age of twelve (12).
DAYCARE, HOME: A family home which receives four (4) up to a maximum of twelve (12) children for less than twenty four (24) hours per day, which
meets the licensing requirements of the state of Illinois, department of children and family services. The number counted includes the family's natural or
adopted children and all other persons under the age of twelve (12). The term does not include facilities which receive only children from a single
household.
DECK: An exterior floor supported on at least two (2) opposing sides by an adjacent structure and/or posts, piers or other independent supports and which
is typically constructed of wood.
DENSITY, GROSS: The numerical value obtained by dividing the total number of dwelling units in a development by the gross area of the tract of land in
acres within a development. For this purpose, gross area includes all nonresidential land uses as well as rights of way of dedicated streets; the result
being the number of dwelling units per gross acre of land.
DENSITY, NET: The numerical value obtained by dividing the total number of dwelling units in a development by the area of the actual tract of land in
acres upon which the dwelling units are proposed to be located, common open space, and associated recreational facilities within the area; the result
being the number of dwelling units per net residential acre of land. Net density calculations exclude rights of way of publicly dedicated streets and
nonresidential land uses.
DETENTION: A stormwater storage area designed to be normally dry and contains water only when excess stormwater runoff occurs.
DISTRICT ENERGY: An energy system that produces steam, hot water or chilled water at a central location and provides it, through underground pipes, to
buildings for individual use.
DOG RUN: An enclosed outdoor area intended for the exercising and/or containment of dogs or other animals.
DRIVE-THROUGH FACILITY: A facility which is designed to provide products or services to patrons in their car for use or consumption off site.
DRIVEWAY: A pathway for motor vehicles from a street to a structure or use used for service purposes or for access to the structure or use only.
DWELLING: A building, or portion thereof, designed or used exclusively for residential occupancy including single-family dwellings, two-family dwellings,
and multiple-family dwellings, but not including mobile homes, hotels or motels.
Dwelling, Attached Single-Family: A building consisting of dwelling units each of which is attached by a common vertical wall to at least one other
dwelling unit with each dwelling unit having a separate exterior entrance and occupying the ground, including, but not limited to, the following:
"townhouse", "row house", and "duplex". In addition, no dwelling unit or portion thereof within an attached single-family dwelling shall be located
above or below another dwelling unit, and each dwelling unit shall have its primary access to the outside on the ground floor. (See figure 2-4 of this
section.)
Dwelling, Detached Single-Family: A freestanding building containing one dwelling unit. (See figure 2-5 of this section.)
Dwelling, Duplex: A building containing two (2) attached dwelling units only, located side by side. (See figure 2-6 of this section.)
Dwelling, Multiple-Family: A building containing three (3) or more dwelling units. Dwelling units or portions thereof may be located above or below
another dwelling unit, and each dwelling unit may or may not share a common entrance. (See figure 2-7 of this section.)
Dwelling, Single-Family: A building containing one dwelling unit and occupied by one family.
